text: Frank Charles Hodges (26 January 1891 – 5 June 1985) was an English footballer. His regular position was as a forward. He was born in Nechells, Birmingham. He played League football for Birmingham, Manchester United, Wigan Borough and Crewe Alexandra, and also made wartime guest appearances for St Mirren. ==References== ==External links== *Profile at StretfordEnd.co.uk Category:1891 births Category:1985 deaths Category:Footballers from Birmingham, West Midlands Category:English footballers Category:Association football outside forwards Category:Birmingham City F.C. players Category:Manchester United F.C. players Category:Wigan Borough F.C. players Category:Crewe Alexandra F.C. players Category:Stalybridge Celtic F.C. players Category:Sandbach Ramblers F.C. players Category:Manchester North End F.C. players Category:English Football League players Category:St Mirren F.C. wartime guest players
title: Frank Hodges (footballer)
